text: Edward T. Lowe Jr., also known as E.T. Lowe Jr., E.C. Lowe, Edmund T. Lowe, Edward T. Lowe, or Edward Lowe (29 June 1880 in Nashville, Tennessee, United States – 17 April 1973 in Los Angeles, California, United States) was an American film writer, producer and editor. He wrote 120 films between years 1913–1947, produced 18 films and directed one: The Losing Game (1915). In 1913, Lowe worked as the revising editor of screenplays at Essanay Studios. He had two children, Elizabeth Alden Lowe and Edythe Helen Lowe. ==Selected filmography== * Men Who Have Made Love to Me (1918) * Toby's Bow (1919) * Big Game (1921) * Under Two Flags (1922) * Ridin' Wild (1922) * What Wives Want (1923) * The Prisoner (1923) * The Hunchback of Notre Dame (1923) * Red Hot Tires (1925) * The Teaser (1925) * The Sap (1926) * The Man Upstairs (1926) * State Street Sadie (1928) * Broadway (1929) * The Mississippi Gambler (1929) * Hearts of Humanity (1932) * The Unwritten Law (1932) * Shop Angel (1932) * The Vampire Bat (1933) * The World Gone Mad (1933) * Charlie Chan in Egypt (1935) * Charlie Chan in Shanghai (1935) * Bulldog Drummond's Revenge (1937) * Television Spy (1939) * Parole Fixer (1940) * The Girl from Alaska (1942) * A Man's World (1942) * House of Dracula (1945) * Rough, Tough and Ready (1945) ==References== ==External links== * * Lowe, Edward T.
